_meta.notes: Walton-style schemes with concise CQ labels + hints. CQ ids are globally consistent across schemes.

critical_questions.label: Effectiveness
critical_questions.hint: Show evidence the action leads to the goal (A → G).

critical_questions.label: Alternatives
critical_questions.hint: Compare plausible options; justify why this one is best.

critical_questions.label: Side effects
critical_questions.hint: Acknowledge costs/harms and how they’re mitigated.

critical_questions.label: Goal conflicts
critical_questions.hint: Show the action doesn't undermine other important goals.

critical_questions.label: Feasibility
critical_questions.hint: Establish resources, authority, capacity, and timing.

argument_from_consequences.name: Argument from (Good/Bad) Consequences
argument_from_consequences.description: Do/avoid A because of its consequences.

critical_questions.label: Likelihood
critical_questions.hint: Estimate how likely the predicted outcome is.

critical_questions.label: Severity
critical_questions.hint: Explain how important/serious the outcome would be.

critical_questions.label: Countervailing
critical_questions.hint: Address opposing consequences and tradeoffs.

rules_to_case.name: Apply Rule to Case
rules_to_case.description: From general rule to specific case.

critical_questions.label: Rule matching
critical_questions.hint: Show the case meets the rule’s stated conditions.

critical_questions.label: Exceptions
critical_questions.hint: Address whether any rule-exceptions apply.

critical_questions.label: Definition fit
critical_questions.hint: Map the case to each definition criterion.

critical_questions.label: Definition adequacy
critical_questions.hint: Show the definition is accepted/appropriate here.

critical_questions.label: Borderline cases
critical_questions.hint: Handle vagueness and edge cases explicitly.

analogy.name: Argument from Analogy
analogy.description: Transfer judgment from a similar case.

critical_questions.label: Relevant similarities
critical_questions.hint: Specify the material similarities that support transfer.

critical_questions.label: Relevant differences
critical_questions.hint: Acknowledge disanalogies that weaken transfer.

critical_questions.label: Base rate / typicality
critical_questions.hint: Show both cases are typical instances, not outliers.

cause_to_effect.name: Cause to Effect
cause_to_effect.description: From proposed cause to expected effect.

critical_questions.label: Causal strength
critical_questions.hint: Quantify effect size; cite mechanism/regularity if possible.

critical_questions.label: Mechanism
critical_questions.hint: Explain the process linking cause to effect.

critical_questions.label: Temporality
critical_questions.hint: Cause precedes effect.

critical_questions.label: Confounders
critical_questions.hint: Control major confounders; provide robustness checks.

critical_questions.label: Interveners
critical_questions.hint: Rule out blockers; show required conditions hold.

critical_questions.label: Robustness
critical_questions.hint: Replicate across datasets/methods where possible.

correlation_to_causation.name: Correlation to Causation
correlation_to_causation.description: From observed correlation to causal claim.

critical_questions.label: Temporality
critical_questions.hint: Show the putative cause comes before the effect.

critical_questions.label: Confounders
critical_questions.hint: Rule out plausible common causes (backdoors).

critical_questions.label: Mechanism
critical_questions.hint: Give a plausible mechanism linking X to Y.

critical_questions.label: Robustness
critical_questions.hint: Check stability across methods, datasets, model specs.

critical_questions.label: Credibility
critical_questions.hint: Establish expertise, track record, and standing.

critical_questions.label: Domain fit
critical_questions.hint: Show the expert’s domain matches the claim.

critical_questions.label: Reliability
critical_questions.hint: Demonstrate general accuracy/trustworthiness.

critical_questions.label: Bias
critical_questions.hint: Disclose and handle conflicts of interest.

critical_questions.label: Corroboration
critical_questions.hint: Add independent confirming sources.

position_to_know.name: Position to Know (Testimony)
position_to_know.description: Trust a witness/source with privileged access.

critical_questions.label: Access to facts
critical_questions.hint: Show the source had the right information.

critical_questions.label: Reliability
critical_questions.hint: Demonstrate general accuracy/truthfulness.

critical_questions.label: Bias
critical_questions.hint: Disclose and handle conflicts of interest.

critical_questions.label: Corroboration
critical_questions.hint: Provide independent confirming evidence.

example.name: Argument from Example
example.description: Generalize from one or more instances.

critical_questions.label: Sample size
critical_questions.hint: State N and justify that N is sufficient.

critical_questions.label: Representativeness
critical_questions.hint: Justify that examples generalize to the target.

critical_questions.label: Defeaters
critical_questions.hint: Name known exceptions and why they don't apply.

sign.name: Argument from Sign
sign.description: Infer a state from an observed sign/symptom.

critical_questions.label: Sign reliability
critical_questions.hint: Show the sign indicates the state reliably.

critical_questions.label: Alt. explanations
critical_questions.hint: Rule out plausible rival explanations for the sign.

critical_questions.label: Base rate
critical_questions.hint: Provide base rates / error rates (FPR/FNR).

critical_questions.label: Measurement
critical_questions.hint: Show observation quality / measurement accuracy.
